Title:
First report of Pseudopithomyces maydicus causing strawberry
leaf spots in China
Keywords:
Didymosphaeriaceae, Fruit, Multigene phylogeny, Pathogen,
Pathogenicity
Abstract:
Strawberry is an economically important fruit crop that is
grown all over the world. It is one of the most cultivated fruit crops
in China due to the strong demand. Strawberry plants are susceptible to
many fungal diseases at different stages of their crop cycle. Leaf spot
symptoms on strawberry leaves were observed in a field in Guangdong
province, China, during a collection survey in summer 2021. The fungus
that caused the leaf spots was isolated in the laboratory. Morphological
characters and with combined gene analysis of LSU, SSU, ITS and TEF1-α
sequence data, identified the pathogen as Pseudopithomyces maydicus
(Didymosphaeriaceae), the fungal species associated with strawberry leaf
spots. The pathogenicity of Pseudopithomyces maydicus was assessed on
potted strawberry leaves and putative pathogen was isolated following
the Kochs postulates. This is the first report of Pseudopithomyces
maydicus causing leaf spots on strawberries in China. This study will
provide novel data to the micro fungi associated with strawberries.
